content: May 5 (Reuters) - CNH Industrial top executives tell analysts in a post-earnings call:

* CEO: THERE MIGHT BE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SMALL ACQUISITIONS TO ENABLE US TO GO EVEN FASTER, BUT I FEEL GOOD ABOUT WHERE WE ARE NOW* CFO: WE ARE CONFIDENT THAT OUR MARGINS WILL INCREASE FOR THE FULL YEAR* CFO: PRICING POWER WILL START FADING YEAR OVER YEAR BUT SO WILL COSTS* CEO: OVERALL OUR MARKET SHARE IS DOWN IN EUROPE, LOOKING TO TURN IT AROUND IN SECOND HALF OF THE YEAR* CFO: WE STARTED RAISING PRICES IN H2 2021 AND CONTINUED TO DO IT QUARTER AFTER QUARTER, WE DON'T EXPECT THIS TO CONTINUE AT THIS PACE FOREVER* CEO: IT'S NOT GOING TO BE A GREAT YEAR FOR OUR CONSTRUCTION BUSINESS BUT IT WILL HAVE A BIT OF HELP FROM THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT* CEO: UAW STRIKE REALLY DIDN'T HURT US FROM A MARGIN PERSPECTIVE Further company coverage: (Reporting by Milan Newsroom)
